dt: {bc}to gain (something, such as goodwill) by pleasing acts

dt.t: It is hard to {wi}conciliate{/wi} the views of labor and management on this point.

pt: {sc}pacify{/sc} {sc}appease{/sc} {sc}placate{/sc} {sc}mollify{/sc} {sc}propitiate{/sc} {sc}conciliate{/sc} mean to ease the anger or disturbance of. {sc}pacify{/sc} suggests a soothing or calming.
{sc}appease{/sc} implies quieting insistent demands by making concessions.
{sc}placate{/sc} suggests changing resentment or bitterness to goodwill.
{sc}mollify{/sc} implies soothing hurt feelings or rising anger.
{sc}propitiate{/sc} implies averting anger or malevolence especially of a superior being.
{sc}conciliate{/sc} suggests ending an estrangement by persuasion, concession, or settling of differences.

et: Latin {it}conciliatus{/it}, past participle of {it}conciliare{/it} to assemble, unite, win over, from {it}concilium{/it} assembly, council {ma}{mat|council|}{/ma}
shortdef: to gain (something, such as goodwill) by pleasing acts
